channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Hazardous waste fly tipped overnight, 17th February
item.description:
Hazardous building waste (paint cans - half full, bottles of chemicals, offcut wood with nails) dumped here overnight 10th Feb. Not residential waste and hasn't come from nearby property. Dangerous to be left here and can't be put in black top bins.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Vicarage Park, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Couch and bags of trash in walkway on Floor 1, 17th February
item.description:
Couch and bags of trash sitting for several days in the walkway on 1st floor of the building next to 78 Garnham Close

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Garnham Close, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Someone dumped a random car seat, 17th February
item.description:
There is a random car seat left on our planter for the last month or so. No one picked it up so it was left. It is too big to fit in the bins.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 23, Adys Road, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Yellow Line in front of private parking space has worn away, 17th February
item.description:
The yellow line in front of the private parking space for 25 Burnhill Rd (BR3 3LA), which actually opens onto Stanmore Terrace (BR3 3LG), has almost completely worn away. (Planning permission granted 8/10/1984 - Application No: 84.1604). Even the Traffic Warden is not aware there is a yellow line, and cars are frequently parked blocking access. We request that the yellow line is renewed so it is clear that there is no parking allowed across the entrance to the parking space.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stanmore Terrace, Beckenham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Grange Walk, Old Kent Road, Greater London

item.title: Van parked on entire pavement on Grange Walk, 17th February
item.description:
A van has been parked on the pavement for over an hour this morning. There is no sign of a permit to park and it does not appear to be an emergency and there are no workmen present. The registration is NU74 POF. The location is Grange Walk, close to No.67

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Grange Walk, Old Kent Road, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 2 or 3 Potholes, 17th February
item.description:
There are 2 or 3 potholes between Wyborne school and the corner of Castleford Ave with Cambridge Green. They have bottomed out and are putting bits of hardcore on the surface that are big enough to cause serious harm to people and vehicles if they get flung up by cars.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Cambridge Green, Eltham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tarmac rises and dips, 17th February
item.description:
The tarmac over a large square area outside German Donner 222 Borough High Street, SE1 1JX Bus Stop D caused me to fall over and injure my foot. The tarmac is uneven approx four inches high then sinks to four inches deep, it has risen up to the top of the footpath kerbside. I have taken video and photographs
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Borough High Street, The Borough, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
